fnBoolean

public static boolean fnBoolean(org.treetank.api.IReadTransaction rtx,
                                org.treetank.axis.AbsAxis axis)
                         throws org.treetank.exception.TTXPathException

The effective boolean value of a value is defined as the result of applying the fn:boolean function to the value, as defined in [XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators].]

  • If its operand is an empty sequence, fn:boolean returns false.
  • If its operand is a sequence whose first item is a node, fn:boolean returns true.
  • If its operand is a singleton value of type xs:boolean or derived from xs:boolean, fn:boolean returns the value of its operand unchanged.
  • If its operand is a singleton value of type xs:string, xs:anyURI, xs:untypedAtomic, or a type derived from one of these, fn:boolean returns false if the operand value has zero length; otherwise it returns true.
  • If its operand is a singleton value of any numeric type or derived from a numeric type, fn:boolean returns false if the operand value is NaN or is numerically equal to zero; otherwise it returns true.
  • In all other cases, fn:boolean raises a type error [err:FORG0006].

    • Parameters:
    rtx - the transaction to operate on.
    axis - Expression to get the effective boolean value for
    Returns:
    true if sucessfull, false otherwise
    Throws:
    org.treetank.exception.TTXPathException

    fnData

    public static boolean fnData(org.treetank.api.IReadTransaction rtx,
                             org.treetank.axis.AbsAxis axis)
    fn:data takes a sequence of items and returns a sequence of atomic values. The result of fn:data is the sequence of atomic values produced by applying the following rules to each item in the input sequence: If the item is an atomic value, it is returned. If the item is a node, its typed value is returned (err:FOTY0012 is raised if the node has no typed value.)

    Parameters:
    rtx - the transaction to operate on
    axis - The sequence to atomize.
    Returns:
    true, if an atomic value can be returned

    fnNilled

    public static boolean fnNilled(org.treetank.api.IReadTransaction rtx,
                               org.treetank.axis.AbsAxis axis)

    fn:nilled($arg as node()?) as xs:boolean?

    Returns an xs:boolean indicating whether the argument node is "nilled". If the argument is not an element node, returns the empty sequence. If the argument is the empty sequence, returns the empty sequence.

    Parameters:
    rtx - the transaction to operate on
    axis - The sequence containing the node to test its nilled property
    Returns:
    true, if current item is a node that has the nilled property (only elements)

    fnNodeName

    public static boolean fnNodeName(org.treetank.api.IReadTransaction rtx,
                                 org.treetank.axis.AbsAxis axis)

    fn:node-name($arg as node()?) as xs:QName?

    Returns an expanded-QName for node kinds that can have names. For other kinds of nodes it returns the empty sequence. If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.

    Parameters:
    rtx - the transaction to operate on
    axis - The sequence, containing the node, to return its QName
    Returns:
    true, if node has a name

    public static boolean fnnumber(org.treetank.api.IReadTransaction rtx)

    Parameters:
    rtx - Read Transaction.
    Returns:
    fnnumber boolean.
